biography.value:
Sir Talavar is an esteemed member of the Seelie Court and a loyal vassal of the Summer Queen. Many of Sir Talavar’s squires have gone on to become knights of great renown. The venerable faerie dragon has an encouraging, can-do demeanor and an unwavering sense of honor.

Alignment. Lawful good.

Personality Trait. “My speech is riddled with references to adventures I have undertaken.”

Ideal. “A little kindness goes a long way.”

Bond. “I am but a humble vassal of Her Magnificence, the Summer Queen.”

Flaw. “My knightly oaths are tested most strongly by my craving for hard candy.”

Roleplaying Sir Talavar

Sir Talavar is a knight-errant of the Seelie Court and a loyal vassal of the Summer Queen. Appendix D has additional roleplaying notes for Sir Talavar.

The violet faerie dragon has an upbeat demeanor and is a strict observer of noble etiquette and courtesies. He knows the way to Downfall and can point characters
in the right direction. He can also impart the following useful information:

  • Bavlorna Blightstraw lives in a spooky cottage on stilts at the heart of Downfall, a bullywug settlement. The bullywugs of Downfall are quite courteous and welcoming, provided one does not offend them.
  • Bavlorna has the ability to conjure minions that look like tiny versions of herself.
  • Bavlorna has two sisters whom she loathes. Together, the three hags form the Hourglass Coven.
  • Using an artifact called Iggwilv’s Cauldron, the coven has frozen time in Zybilna’s palace, trapping the archfey inside.
  • A goblin named Jingle Jangle has the key to Sir Talavar’s birdcage. She lives atop Telemy Hill, not too far from Slanty Tower.

Sir Talavar explains that he must be set free so that he can return to his queen and report the news that Zybilna has been overthrown by the Hourglass Coven.

If the characters are unable to open the birdcage on their own, Sir Talavar asks them to get the key from Jingle Jangle, offering them his magic sword in return for his release.

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + @mod + 1 type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1 piercing average=false]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Sir Talavar exhales a puff of euphoria gas at one creature within 5 feet of him. The target must succeed on a [[/save wis 11 format=long]], or for 1 minute, the target can’t take reactions and must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior during the turn:

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The target takes no action or bonus action and uses all of its movement to move in a random direction.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The target doesn’t move, and the only thing it can do on its turn is make a [[/save wis 11 format=long]], ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Superior Invisibility. As a bonus action, Sir Talavar can magically turn &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until his &Reference[concentration]{concentration} ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment Sir Talavar wears or carries is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} with him.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Limited Telepathy. Using telepathy, Sir Talavar can magically communicate with any other faerie &Reference[dragon]{dragon} within 60 feet of him.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. Sir Talavar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. Sir Talavar’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast a number of spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components. As the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} ages and changes color, it gains additional spells as shown below.

Red, 1/day each: dancing lights, mage hand, minor &Reference[ill]{illusion}

Orange, 1/day: color spray

Yellow, 1/day: mirror image

Green, 1/day: suggestion

Blue, 1/day: major image

Indigo, 1/day: hallucinatory terrain

Violet, 1/day: polymorph

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
